result.execSummary:
The defendant Marten K Hester was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marten K Hester

records.addlTxt: Judgment for Unpaid Fines/Forfeitures - Returned as Undeliverable
Application for Jail Time Credit form

Court in session at 216 pm. Matter is on for a competency hearing/plea sentencing hearing on 21CF450, 22CF117, 21TR2638,2639 & 2640.  Appearances made.  Attorney Tony Kim in court for Marten K Hester, in custody.  Attorney J J. Crawford in court for State of Wisconsin. Dr. Seipel is appearing via phone. At the last hearing defendant felt he was not competent to proceed. Defendant feels he is competent to proceed today. Defense would like to proceed. pleading guilty to count #1 in 21CF450 and count #1 in 22CF117. Remaining counts being dismissed and read in. Court goes over plea questionnaire. 
Court gives WARNINGS regarding deportation, felon prohibited from firearm possession pursuant to Sec. 941.29, ineligibility to vote until civil rights restored, prohibition of child offender working with children pursuant to Sec. 948.13 and possession of body armor prohibited pursuant to Sec. 941.291. Court accepts plea and adjudges defendant guilty. Court proceeds to sentencing.

227 pm Sentencing argument by ADA Crawford
232 pm Sentencing argument by Atty Kim

235 pm Defendant makes statement to the court

236 pm Court goes over sentencing objectives/factors


SENTENCE

21CF450 - CT #1
Withheld sentence for 3 years probation
12 months conditional jail time with work release
$3800 fine plus court costs
DNA sample / surcharge
No alcohol 
No drugs or drug paraphernalia
No bars, taverns or liquor stores
No driving without a valid drivers license
Attendance of Victim Impact Panel
Counseling as recommended
Restitution held open 60 days
A & R
36 months drivers license revocation
36 month IID requirement
BAC .224
No early termination of probation
137 days credit, if revoked



21CF117 - CT#1
Costs only 
DNA sample/surcharge
Application for Jail Time Credit form

Defendant Marten K Hester in court, in custody via video.  Attorney Tony Kim in court for Marten K Hester.  Attorney J J. Crawford in court for State of Wisconsin. Per atty Kim defendant is not contesting competency and to set over for plea/sentencing. Defendant states he feels he is not competent to proceed.  Record by State. No further response by defense. Court sets over for combined competency hearing, doctor to be subpoenaed and plea/sentencing. Minutes filed.
Competency hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Subpoena - Dr. M.S. from WFU for 4-27 at 2pm

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting attorney Zeke S Wiedenfeld in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Marten K Hester in court, in custody.  Attorney Tony Kim in court for Marten K Hester. Attorney Kim raises competency. Court finds there is reason to doubt defendant's competency to proceed and Orders a Competency Examination - Sec. 971.14. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Marten K Hester in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Tony Kim in court for Marten K Hester. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Minutes filed.
Plea hearing scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court
Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.

2:00 PM (64-06)  Defendant Marten K Hester appeared in court, in custody via video. Attorney Tony Kim for Marten K Hester appeared in court. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing. 
Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
Attorney Kim acknowledged the receipt of the Information, waived reading and plead not guilty to all charges on behalf of his client.


Adj. 2:04 PM
Signed bond filed with the court.

TOTAL BOND TO COVER 22CF117 & 21CF450

DEFENDANT MUST POST $500 CASH (posted 10-27-21)
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall have "0" blood alcohol in his/her body whenever driving/operating a motor vehicle.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Called at 8:45 am. Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Marten K Hester appeared in court. Was set for plea and sentencing, but new file asks for plea hearing. State asks prior bond be forfeited and new bond. Attorney Renner asks that prior bond covers new filed or ROR Bond. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
